title: Assessing the Development Prospects of Carbon Capture and Storage from the Perspective of Law and Economics
content:
Abstract
This review article examines Faure and Partainâ€™s book Carbon Capture and Storage: Efficient Legal Policies for Risk Governance and Compensation. In nine chapters, extending across almost 220 pages, Faure and Partain present us with a great deal of key analytical insights regarding current carbon capture and storage (CCS) policies. Following their viewpoints, we methodically show the applicability of a law and economics tool to regulate CCS liabilities and further propose to integrate CCS projects into the emission trading system.
